Stop-Signal Task.Description: Stop-Signal Task which used food sitimuli that varied in energy density and portion size
Stop-Signal Task.DatasetType: derivitive - summary data produced by code/SST_WF.py

block.Description: Block number for the task - the number does corresponds to order

Levels.hED_lPort: high energy dense, large portion food stimuli
Levels.hED_sPort: high energy dense, small portion food stimuli
Levels.lED_lPort: low energy dense, large portion food stimuli
Levels.lED_sPort: low energy dense, small portion food stimuli

racehorse_check.Description: check of the racehorse assumption for the Stop-Signal Task (mean go reaction time > mean reaction time during unsuccessful stops) for given block

n_stop_trials.Description: number of stop trials for given block

n_go_trials.Description: number of go trials for given block

go_rt.Description: average go reaction time for given block

n_go_cor.Description: number of correct responses (left/right) for given block

go_cor_rt.Description: average reaction time for given block

n_go_error.Description: number of errors (left/right) for given block

go_error_rt.Description: average go reaction time on trials with errors for given block

n_go_miss.Description: number of missed go trial responses for given block

stop_prob_resp.Description: probability of responding on stop trials for given block - p(resp|stop signal)

us_rt.Description: average reaction time on unsucessful stop trials for given block

ssd.Description: average stop-signal delay for given block

ssrt_mean.Description: stop-signal reaction time calculated using the mean method (mean go rt - mean ssd) for given block. Only calcualted if racehorse assumption is met

ssrt_int.Description: stop-signal reaction time calculated using the integration method (nth rt - mean ssd) for given block. Only calcualted if racehorse assumption is met
